normalised: ## Flash Sales: Faster Than a Mumbai Local at nine hundred hours!

unnormalised: Let's face it, folks. We all love a good bargain. And in the cutthroat world of retail and e-commerce, the Flash Sale is the Sultan of Saving, the Maharaj of Money-Off, the... well, you get the picture. It's basically a frantic online jalebi eating contest, but instead of sticky fingers, you end up with a sweet deal (hopefully!).

unnormalised: But what *is* a Flash Sale? Imagine this: you're chilling, sipping chai on your balcony in Bandra, scrolling through Instagram. Suddenly, BAM! An ad pops up: "Sarees at 70% off! Valid for 3 hours only!" That, my friend, is a Flash Sale winking at you. It's a limited-time offer, usually on a specific product or category, designed to create a sense of urgency. Think of it like convincing your bua that she absolutely *needs* that latest gadget *right now* because “kal kisne dekha hai?”

unnormalised: Why do companies do it? Simple, beta. It’s a great way to clear out old stock, boost sales figures (especially before that crucial 31/03 deadline!), and generate some serious buzz. It's like Garba night for your wallet – exhilarating, a little overwhelming, and you might just stumble upon something amazing (or trip over your own feet in the excitement).

unnormalised: However, beware the Flash Sale FOMO! Don’t let the ticking clock turn you into a "cart addition" maniac. Remember that kurta you bought during the Diwali sale on 14/11/2020 which is still lying unworn in your cupboard? Think before you click. Ask yourself, “Do I *really* need that pressure cooker just because it’s Rs. 500 off?”

unnormalised: Ultimately, Flash Sales can be a great way to snag a deal. Just remember to keep a cool head, a steady internet connection (courtesy of that pesky Jio router!), and a healthy dose of skepticism. Happy shopping, and may the best browser win! Just try not to end up spending more than you would at a normal sale, okay? Your Amma will have your hide! Remember her warning at 16:30 hrs about impulsive shopping, na?
